title: Improving Monocular Visual-Inertial Initialization with Structureless Visual-Inertial Bundle Adjustment
author: Junlin Song (Space Robotics Research Group, University of Luxembourg), Antoine Richard (University of Luxembourg), Miguel Olivares-Mendez (University of Luxembourg), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses visual-inertial odometry, which may offer insights into methods for audio-visual alignment or enhancement tasks in generative AI.
background: Monocular visual-inertial odometry aims to accurately track movements using camera and IMU data, requiring efficient initialization to ensure reliable performance.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel structureless visual-inertial bundle adjustment to enhance the accuracy of VIO initialization, significantly reducing computational costs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically rely on reconstructing 3D structures which is computationally intensive.
technical_comparison.novelty: The proposed method optimizes initial VIO states without needing 3D structure reconstruction, focusing instead on epipolar constraints, thereby improving computational efficiency.

key_innovation: The method uniquely combines the benefits of visual epipolar constraints and IMU preintegration without reconstructing 3D landmarks, leading to faster and more accurate initialization.
real_world_impact: By improving initialization accuracy in VIO systems, this approach can enhance real-time applications in augmented reality, robotics, and autonomous navigation.
limitations: The paper does not specify any explicit limitations.

new_terms.visual-inertial odometry (VIO): **Visual-inertial odometry (VIO)** refers to the technique of estimating the position and orientation of a sensor using both visual data from a camera and inertial data from an Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU).
new_terms.epipolar constraints: **Epipolar constraints** are geometric constraints that relate pairs of images taken from different viewpoints, used in vision tasks to link corresponding points.
